summary: This bill, the Tax Relief for Victims of Crimes, Scams, and Disasters Act, aims to provide tax relief to individuals affected by personal casualty losses (losses due to crime, scams, and disasters). It reinstates the personal casualty loss deduction for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2017, amending the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Further, it extends the time limit for filing claims for credit or refund related to this deduction for tax years before 2025.
